    • Method Detail

      • getAllRepositories

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllRepositories()
        Returns the list of URLs for all configured package repositories.
        Returns:
        list of URLs, or null if the repository management is not supported by this package management service.

      • fetchAllRepositories

        public void fetchAllRepositories(CatchingConsumer<? super java.util.List<java.lang.String>,? super java.lang.Exception> consumer)
        An async version of getAllRepositories().

      • canManageRepositories

        public boolean canManageRepositories()
        Returns true if the service supports managing repositories.

      • canModifyRepository

        public boolean canModifyRepository(java.lang.String repositoryUrl)
        Checks if the user can change the URL of the specified repository or remove it from the list.
        Parameters:
        repositoryUrl - the URL to check
        Returns:
        true if can be modified, false otherwise.

      • addRepository

        public void addRepository(java.lang.String repositoryUrl)

      • removeRepository

        public void removeRepository(java.lang.String repositoryUrl)

      • compareVersions

        public int compareVersions(java.lang.String version1,
                           java.lang.String version2)
        Returns:
        a negative integer, if the first version is older than the second, zero, if the versions are equals, a positive integer, if the first version is newer than the second.

      • getAllPackages

        public abstract java.util.List<RepoPackage> getAllPackages()
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the list of all packages in all configured repositories. Called in a background thread and may initiate network connections. May return cached data.
        Returns:
        the list of all packages in all repositories
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • reloadAllPackages

        public abstract java.util.List<RepoPackage> reloadAllPackages()
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reloads the lists of packages for all configured repositories and returns the results. Called in a background thread and may initiate network connections. May not return cached data.
        Returns:
        the list of all packages in all repositories
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAllPackagesCached

        public java.util.List<RepoPackage> getAllPackagesCached()
        Returns the cached list of all packages in all configured repositories, or an empty list if there is no cached information available.
        Returns:
        the list of all packages or an empty list.

      • canInstallToUser

        public boolean canInstallToUser()
        Returns true if the 'install to user' checkbox should be visible.

      • getInstallToUserText

        public java.lang.String getInstallToUserText()
        Returns the text of the 'install to user' checkbox.
        Returns:
        the text of the 'install to user' checkbox.

      • isInstallToUserSelected

        public boolean isInstallToUserSelected()
        Returns true if the 'install to user' checkbox should be initially selected.

      • installToUserChanged

        public void installToUserChanged(boolean newValue)
        Called when the 'install to user' checkbox is checked or unchecked.

      • getInstalledPackages

        public abstract java.util.Collection<InstalledPackage> getInstalledPackages()
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the list of packages which are currently installed.
        Returns:
        the collection of currently installed packages.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • installPackage

        public abstract void installPackage(RepoPackage repoPackage,
                                    java.lang.String version,
                                    boolean forceUpgrade,
                                    java.lang.String extraOptions,
                                    PackageManagementService.Listener listener,
                                    boolean installToUser)
        Installs the specified package. Called in the event dispatch thread; needs to take care of spawning a background task itself.
        Parameters:
        repoPackage - the package to install
        version - the version selected by the user, or null if the checkbox to install a specific version is not checked
        forceUpgrade - if true, the latest version of the package is installed even if there is already an installed version
        extraOptions - additional options entered by the user
        listener - the listener that must be called to publish information about the installation progress
        installToUser - the state of the "install to user" checkbox (ignore if not applicable)

      • uninstallPackages

        public abstract void uninstallPackages(java.util.List<InstalledPackage> installedPackages,
                                       PackageManagementService.Listener listener)

      • fetchPackageVersions

        public abstract void fetchPackageVersions(java.lang.String packageName,
                                          CatchingConsumer<java.util.List<java.lang.String>,java.lang.Exception> consumer)

      • fetchPackageDetails

        public abstract void fetchPackageDetails(java.lang.String packageName,
                                         CatchingConsumer<java.lang.String,java.lang.Exception> consumer)

      • getID

        public java.lang.String getID()
        Returns:
        identifier of this service for reported usage data (sent for JetBrains implementations only). Return null to avoid reporting any usage data.
